content: rivenhall square by jacqui goulbourn difficulty level intermediate terminology us terms skills required front post and back post stitches popcorns and bullions yarn any weight of yarn according to the required size of the finished square the sample is shown in yarnsmiths create dk hook size to achieve gauge size 12 inch square in worsted weight yarn 8 5 inches in dk weight introduction this square is compatible with block a month selected squares in that it should measure 12 inches if worked in worsted weight yarn and has a stitch count of 39 sts per side i have used yarnsmiths create dk in a pink berry b sand c petal pink and d canary yellow rivenhall is a small village in central essex best know for being a service stop on the busy main road through the county less well known are the regular get togethers of the essex lacemakers which happen in the local community hall this pdf download is safe to use and free from viruses it has no embedded links abbreviations bpdc back post double_crochet blo back loop only bpsc back post single_crochet round s round s chain chain stitch single_crochet single_crochet chain-space chain space skip skip double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch half_double_crochet half_double_crochet space s space s fpsc front post single_crochet st s stitch es fptr front post treble_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet catkitbob designs rivenhall012025v1 page 1 of 7 fp2trtog work first front post treble_crochet bullion wrap yarn around hook 7 times until 2 loops are left on hook then place hook in st and pull up a work second front post treble loop yarn over and pull through crochet until 3 loops are left on all loops on hook chain 1 to close hook yarn over and pull through all 3 loops popcorn work 5 double_crochet in same base st remove hook from loop and insert it in top of first double_crochet pull working loop through rivenhall square instructions notes - the 1st double_crochet of each round can be worked either as chain 3 or standing double_crochet for 1st half_double_crochet chain 2 or standing half_double_crochet this also applies when starting a round with a popcorn st - finish each round by joining to the top of the first st of the round - colour changes are indicated in 2nd column there are not specific instructions to finish off each colour - depending on your gauge some rnds may not lie flat but later rnds will correct this rrnndd col instructions shape total our at end stitches of round set a chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form a ring or work magic_ring up 1 a chain 1 does not count as st 6 single_crochet in ring circle 6 single_crochet 2 a *2 double_crochet in next st chain 1* repeat from * to * 5 more times circle 12 double_crochet 6 chain- space 3 b *popcorn in chain-space chain 4* repeat from * to * 5 more times circle 6 popcorn 6 chain- space 4 c starting
